Title: mount-cifs: Multiple vulnerabilites
Synopsis:
Multiple vulnerabilities were found in mount-cifs, the worst of
    which leading to privilege escalation.

Background.Text: mount-cifs is the cifs filesystem mount helper split from Samba.

Description.Text: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in mount-cifs. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.

Impact.Text: The vulnerabilities allow local users to cause a denial of service (mtab corruption) via a crafted string. Also, local users could mount a CIFS share on an arbitrary mountpoint, and gain privileges via a symlink attack on the mountpoint directory file.

Workaround.Text: There is no known workaround at this time.

P.Text:
Gentoo has discontinued support for mount-cifs. We recommend that users
      unmerge mount-cifs:
